title: Is it true that iPhone makers plan to shift manufacturing to India from China? - Quora

response.answer_text: Apple had already started manufacturing iPhone 6S, 7 and 8 in 2017 in their Wistron Plant near Bangalore. Since August 2019, they have also been assembling iPhone XR. It’s not much difficult for Apple to expand to other iPhone or maybe even MacBooks and iPads. They are definitely looking for alternative countries to spread out the manufacturing process. They have definitely learnt well from Corona Virus lockdowns across China. At the moment, it’s difficult something like this will happen this year itself. More likely 2022 will be a safe bet when Apple actually manufacturers the latest generation iPhone from India. Presently it manufactures only old model. I would like to clarify, that it’s not “shifting” it’s “expanding”. Because they won’t be shutting down the existing plants in China. They might downsize, but will never shut down. They’ll only spread more plants around the world, but China will still remain the manufacturing hub for not only Apple but many others.
